intro: Phyllorkis prismophylis, commonly known as the prismophyllis fern, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, lace-like fronds that exhibit a unique structural arrangement of leaflets. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sporangia, are positioned on the underside of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phyllorkis prismophylis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
